Reviews.Title: “Deaming of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Vegas2113
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Chicago Midway Airport for what for what we thought was a short lay over had turned in to an overnight stay. With having stayed at a Residence Inn a couple other times we gave them a call. With all the snow we were not dressed for the great Chicago area so food was an issue. When we arrived at the hotel we found the staff had ordered in food and drinks. What a blessing! They made us fell welcomed the minute we walked through the door.. The hotel and room was very clean and comfotable. They went out of their way to make our stay the best.. I would highly would recommend my friends and family to stay with Maria and her staff if ever in the area...

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Michele45030
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a quick vacation on a Wednesday night. The man at the front desk was extremely helpful with explaining how to get the shuttle that would take us to the L station at the airport. He also gave us great information and a map of Chicago and showed us where the L stations were in town. We felt very welcomed and informed. The shuttle to the airport was very nice and free! The shuttle runs every 20 min. The drivers we had were friendly. The shuttle does serve the all of the hotels in the complex so plan for extra time for stops. Our room was huge and clean. I slept better than I have in a long time in a hotel room. My kids loved having their own room and TV. The pool was huge, clean and warm. The woman working the breakfast area was fantastic!! She actually came to our table and removed our dirty plates. I have never had that happen before. The breakfast was well stocked and the food was good. The only problem was finding the hotel in the dark. It is in an area that has quite a few hotels and finding the correct driveway was difficult. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelsmart568
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Residence Inn - Midway on a recent business trip and, quite frankly, wasn't expecting much; I certainly didn't anticipate the stay resulting in a tripadvisor review. I travel quite a bit each year but NEVER have I stayed at property with a more delightful staff. From check in to check out every employee at this hotel was courteous, friendly and helpful. I arrived a few hours later than anticipated and thought my dinner would be delivery pizza or the chocolate bar at the bottom of my carry-on. Was I ever suprised to see that several restaurants deliver until 10 and 11 o'clock at night; yes - there were even menus in the room. Both my room and the hotel, in general, were very clean and comfortable. (For those on you who are light sleepers like myself - the fan on the thermostat was perfect for drowning out background noise!)

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: leo h
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel and staff. I stayed for an extended period for work, and the staff is like no other hotel staff I've ever stayed with. They truly enjoy having you as there guest. And they go out of their way to make sure you have a pleasant stay. Maria the manager is truly a rare find, and is a great people person. I can honestly say I miss her and her staffs wonderful personalities and "smiles" everyday...

Reviews.Title: “Would have paid if it wasn't free!”
Reviews.Author: BTCompKSU
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel using my Marriott rewards points. We weren't expecting much, since normally you don't get much when it comes to reward program redemption, but from the moment we got to the hotel (via free shuttle from the airport), everything was wonderful. The staff bent over backwards to welcome us to the hotel. We were greeted by a "manager's reception" which they may have well called dinner (included with the room stay). Our menu featured baked fish, fries, coleslaw, and more, complete with wine & cheese, as well as a selection of desserts. After dinner, we headed up to our room, which was a suite that, in addition to a full bath and king size bed, included its own kitchenette, fold out sofa, microwave complimentary bag of microwave popcorn and two flat screen televisions. The room was clean and comfortable too. In the morning we were treated to a full hot buffet breakfast, also included with our stay. Even though I don't have a base of comparison to the other properties at Midway, this was definitely one of the nicer hotels that we've stayed at and I would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Suitable hotel, albeit pricey given locale”
Reviews.Author: MiddleNameGO10019
Reviews.Content: Had to get to northern Indiana from NYC so I flew into Midway then stayed the night.at this property about :15 away from Midway airport. It was a quick overnight stay but I found this newer hotel to be quiet, the studio room very comfortable with a thoughtful layout (I could easily see staying here for a longer term) - a huge flat screen TV, comfy sofa, a kitchen as big as mine in Manhattan, nice work desk, dinette . . . probably my sole complaint about the room is that the lone blanket was very meager and I was cold, but unwilling to turn on the heat which would have only made the room stuffy. Parking was free and convenient. The staff person at check in (late flight arrival) was very cheerful and more than helpful in his desire to assist me with my directions for the next morning. The next morning I grabbed a couple of things for breakfast and took them to my room. The breakfast was far from memorable but I suppose better than nothing if you have to get on the road. Overall I found the hotel tidy, quiet, bright, with a nice but predictable decor. I would return. While the price seemed pretty outrageous, it was in line with others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, but hotel needs a little work”
Reviews.Author: caftan1874
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on an extended stay and have to say that it was a really nice hotel. The room was more than spacious, great kitchen, bathroom was clean, and really new looking. Check in was easy, front desk was very nice and polite and breakfast/dinner attendants were wonderful and took care of us. The hotel also provides a free shuttle which was great and free internet. There aren't many options for food around except for overpriced hotel restaurants. There is a Giordano's and White Castle down the street that were decent. If you walk too far you will be in the ghetto, so watch out! The shuttle runs every 20 minutes or so and is usually prompt. My biggest concerns were over people lingering around the hotel that don't appear to be guests. During breakfast and mostly dinner I observed quite a few cars pull up, people walking over from other nearby hotels, and getting in line for food. Basketball court, pool and whirlpool, and guest computer were also tied up by 'non-guests'. There needs to be a way to keep people out of the hotel for the safety of paying guests. It made me feel a little unsafe at times. Other than this, I would absolutely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Valerie C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on an extended business trip to Chicago. Wasn't sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised. Rooms was comfortable, spacious and warm. Will recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and very nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JennieIndy
Reviews.Content: My family was in town for my Mother's 80th Birthday and we were thrilled with this hotel. The staff is excellent and the service is great. I loved the taco party on Thursday night!

Reviews.Title: “very good , but.........”
Reviews.Author: rdkhader
Reviews.Content: We like this hotel. The suites are moderate size. The snack hour in the evening is very good . The only bad thing was the lady in the breakfast room on week days, she is mesn and rude. Sometimes, you hate to go down when she is there. But the lady on the weekend " Lupe" is very nice and friendly. The kids loved her. I won't be back to this hotel because of the breakfast service. They have excellent water pressure in the shower, we loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: halfcafqueen
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a long weekend at the Residence Inn Chicago Midway. Nice breakfast spread, beautiful room. The shuttle to the airport was convenient and ran at regular intervals. Priced much better than hotels in the city; if you don't mind a 30-45 minute train ride in each direction, this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, and Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Doc_Genetics
Reviews.Content: This Residence Inn is very close to Midway Airport and about 10 minutes away from Downtown Chicago if traffic on I-55 is moving normally. The premise is very clean, safe, quiet despite the air traffics nearby. It has great breakfast and a good selection of options. Everyone at the front desk is very friendly. This is not a good spot if you are vacationing but it is a good spot if you are making a quick stop or has business in Chicago area.

Reviews.Title: “Airport location much quieter and secluded than the Magnificent Mile one”
Reviews.Author: larabarccp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights last summer and had a wonderful time. I've stayed in many Residence Inns and this is my favorite so far. The Marriott shuttle picked us up from the airport, which was just minutes away. When we walked through the door, the staff was very friendly and accommodating and made us feel like we were only guests there. Our room was comfortable and quiet. Kitchenette, laundry and big sofa bed always appreciated. The complimentary breakfast buffet was standard Residence Inn food, but it wasn't busy and there was always seating for us in the lobby. We loved coming back from a long day of sightseeing to the free dinners on weekdays; the stuffed cabbage meal was delicious. The only drawback to this hotel was that it's relatively far from Chicago's main attractions (not within walking distance to most), but we had a rental car and a GPS so that wasn't a problem for us. Would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: PghRunnerGirl
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to the proximity to the University of Chicago without staying in the city. The room was perfect for our needs--very clean & tastefully decorated! Loved the pivotal flat-screen TV, which you could see from anywhere in the room except the bathroom! The fitness room was sufficient although it could have used a fan for better ventilation. A computer is available to guests. The free breakfast was superb with pancakes, waffles, scrambled eggs, sausage, potatoes, yogurt, oatmeal, fruit, cereal, etc.--lots of choices!! Restaurants nearby are TGIF, a restaurant at the Holiday Inn (walking distance), and Giordano's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service...”
Reviews.Author: allieoop72
Reviews.Content: My stay was delightful. Excellent Service. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: keharty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night. The check in was a breeze with very friendly staff. The room was absolutely beautiful, one of the nicest rooms I've stayed in. Everything was clean and new. The kitchen area was fully stocked with dishes, utensils, etc. The flat screen was very nice and could be rotated to face the couch area to towards the bed. Lots of power outlets for cell phones, laptops or other items needing to be charged and free WiFi. While I probably won't be traveling to Chicago again any time soon I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel at Midway!!!”
Reviews.Author: grensi
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for one night on our way to downtown Chicago for the weekend. Hotel is top notch in every way. Clean rooms, great pool for the kids and a nice variety of food on the breakfast bar. Every member of the staff went out of there way to make our stay enjoyable. If you are in the Chicago Midway area, make sure to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: bearded_bard
Reviews.Content: From the moment we registered until we checked out the next day, we were treated as if were were royalty. The staff went out of their way to let us know how much they appreciated our choosing to stay there. Our request for more towels & a baby crib were handled quickly & courteously. They even refused my tip, saying it wasn't necessary. Our king suite with separate bedroom gave all 5 of us plenty of room. Our daughter & son-in-law enjoyed the luxurious king-sized bed. The sofabed in the living room was disappointingly soft, lumpy & small (full, not queen). Someone had used too much disinfectant in cleaning the kitchen. Fortunately, it eventually dissipated. Otherwise, our suite was great! The midweek complimentary barbeque meal with baked beans, salads, deserts & drinks was very good. Although this is just minutes from Midway Airport, it's well insulated sound-wise. We hardly heard any planes once inside.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: HoangCheng
Reviews.Content: We stopped by Chicago on our road trip with 4 kids from Toronto to Minnesota (oldest child=6 years old). This is a great property that is relatively new (within 2 years). It is located in a campus of Marriott hotels. There is a TGI Fridays within walking distance and Giordano's (famous for their Chicago deep dish pizza) within driving distance - that's pretty much it. The pool is very nice and the rooms are typical residence inn. If you have never stayed here, the one bedroom is the same size as a studio with a wall. Breakfast was great with a waffle maker, fruit loops, fruit, oatmeal, muffins, eggs, coffee - enough to feed the little kids and the parents. Customer service was wonderful and extremely friendly. My only drawback was that there were NO IN-ROOM MOVIES AVAILABLE for the kids. They were a little bored with just a swimming pool. Fitness facility is pretty basic with treadmill and bicycle - small but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Free Beer”
Reviews.Author: odusseia
Reviews.Content: Yes. They serve free beer, wine, drinks, and light dinner from 6:00pm - 7:30pm. Friendly staff. Very comfortable rooms. Quiet. Free internet. Great breakfast. When staying near Midway, this is the place to be. Shuttle service to the airport is available. We stayed on a Wednesday night in June, in a king room on the 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT experience - Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: IrishGal21
Reviews.Content: I usually book stays at a Residence Inn if I'm traveling for work for more than 3 days. From the moment I stepped in to the shuttle to the day that I left, my experience at this particular Res Inn was fantastic. The front desk staff (especially Sharon and Griselda) were incredibly accommodating and always welcomed me with a smile and some small talk. My lodging included a full breakfast every morning and a heavy hors d'ouerves reception at night. The rooms were also clean and spacious. Given that the hotel is relatively new, everything looked great. The hotel itself is conveniently located in the "Midway Hotel Center" which includes several other major hotels (Marriotts, Holiday Inn, etc.), a TGI Friday's, a sports bar, an Irish pub, and a Starbucks. Midway airport is less than 5 minutes away. Advocate Christ Medical Center and several major department chains are within a 10-minute cab ride or drive.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn Chicago Midway
HotelInfo.Address: 6638 South Cicero Avenue, Bedford Park, Chicago, IL 60638
